Key Match Events: Desmond Bane returned to action Thursday after missing one game due to a left ankle sprain.

The Memphis Grizzlies guard scored 16 points on efficient shooting (6-of-10 from the field, 2-of-5 from three), adding four rebounds, four assists, and two steals in 27 minutes during a close 119-115 loss to the Houston Rockets.
Desmond Bane finished as the team’s third-leading scorer behind Ja Morant (27 points) and Jaren Jackson Jr. (21 points).
Post-Match Reflections: Though the Grizzlies fell to Houston, Bane’s presence is a major boost as they push for the playoffs and improve their standings.
His consistency on both ends is vital for a team fighting for a top spot in the West.
With Memphis in a tight race, Bane’s scoring, playmaking, and defensive impact will be crucial moving forward.
